item.title: Kateri add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "Never shall I forget that night, the first night in camp, which has turned my life into one long night, seven times cursed and seven times sealed....Never shall I forget those moments which murdered my God and my soul and turned my dreams to dust. Never shall I forget these things, even if I am condemned to live as long as God Himself. Never." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Kateri add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Vanity and pride are different things, though the words are often used synonymously. A person may be proud without being vain. Pride relates more to our opinion of ourselves, vanity to what we would have others think of us." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Kateri add a quote by Ken Kesey
item.description: "What do you think you are, for Chrissake, crazy or somethin'? Well you're not! You're not! You're no crazier than the average asshole out walkin' around on the streets and that's it. " -- Ken Kesey

item.title: Kateri add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "For you, a thousand times over" -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Kateri add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "But better to get hurt by the truth than comforted with a lie." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Kateri add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "There is a way to be good again..." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Kateri add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "Men are easy,' he said, fingers tapping on his mahogany desk. 'A man's plumbing is like his mind: simple, very few surprises. You ladies, on the other hand...well, God put a lot of thought into making you." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Kateri add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "Atticus said to Jem one day, "I’d rather you shot at tin cans in the backyard, but I know you’ll go after birds. Shoot all the blue jays you want, if you can hit ‘em, but remember it’s a sin to kill a mockingbird." That was the only time I ever heard Atticus say it was a sin to do something, and I asked Miss Maudie about it. "Your father’s right," she said. "Mockingbirds don’t do one thing except make music for us to enjoy. They don’t eat up people’s gardens, don’t nest in corn cribs, they don’t do one thing but sing their hearts out for us. That’s why it’s a sin to kill a mockingbird." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Kateri add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "It was times like these when I thought my father, who hated guns and had never been to any wars, was the bravest man who ever lived." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Kateri add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view... Until you climb inside of his skin and walk around in it." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Kateri add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "Miss Jean Louise, stand up. Your father's passin'." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Kateri add a quote by Paul Rusesabagina
item.description: "I still wonder how policy officials... can sit down at the table with their families and have any appetite for food, or go to sleep at night, knowing that they failed to act. Human beings were sacrificed for political convenience. This would be enough, I think, to turn any reasonable man into a prisoner of his own conscience for the rest of his life." -- Paul Rusesabagina

item.title: Kateri add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Kateri add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Kateri add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "First they ignore you, then they ridicule you, then they fight you, and then you win." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Kateri add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "An eye for an eye will only make the whole world blind." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Kateri add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Freedom is not worth having if it does not include the freedom to make mistakes." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Kateri add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "When I despair, I remember that all through history the way of truth and love have always won. There have been tyrants and murderers, and for a time, they can seem invincible, but in the end, they always fall. Think of it--always." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Kateri add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Kateri add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Kateri add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "I like your Christ, I do not like your Christians. Your Christians are so unlike your Christ." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Kateri add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "I object to violence because when it appears to do good, the good is only temporary; the evil it does is permanent." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Kateri add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description: "Ask not what your country can do for you; ask what you can do for your country." -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Kateri add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description: "Forgive your enemies, but never forget their names." -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Kateri add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "How vain it is to sit down to write when you have not stood up to live." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Kateri add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I learned this, at least, by my experiment: that if one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Kateri add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "The creatures outside looked from pig to man, and from man to pig, and from pig to man again; but already it was impossible to say which was which." -- George Orwell

item.title: Kateri add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Kateri add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Kateri add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson
